title: How to Make Chocolate Scones

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Place the flour into a large mixing bowl, then add the cocoa powder, sugar, salt, chocolate chips, baking powder and baking soda. Mix everything together well with a spoon.

steps.headline: Add the cold butter.
steps.description: Add the cubed cold butter and mix it in with your hands, squishing it through your fingers to incorporate it fully. Don't worry about any lumps that you may have at this point.

steps.headline: Add the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Spoon in the beaten egg yolks, the yogurt and the cream. Using a spoon, combine it all together well to make a chunky dough.

steps.headline: Roll the dough.
steps.description: Sprinkle some flour onto a working surface, place the dough onto it and then sprinkle the dough with some flour. With your rolling pin, start to roll the dough backwards and forwards into a 1.5cm/0.5" thick rough circle. Using the small cutter, cut the dough into 4cm/2" rings and place on a baking tray lined with baking paper. You can also scoop spoonfuls of the dough and drop them on the cookie sheet. Shape as round as possible.

steps.headline: Continue to roll, cut and transfer to the baking tray, until all the dough is used, making sure that there is enough room for expansion between each scone.
steps.description: You may find you have to cook the scones in batches.

steps.headline: Bake.
steps.description: Place the scones into the preheated oven and bake for roughly 12 minutes. Remove from the oven after this time. The time it takes to cook may vary depending on the oven.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Eat them hot or cold with some butter if you wish, or with a dollop of fresh cream and enjoy with your afternoon tea!

text: Preheat the oven. Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F. Combine the dry ingredients. Place the flour into a large mixing bowl, then add the cocoa powder, sugar, salt, chocolate chips, baking powder and baking soda. Mix everything together well with a spoon. Add the cold butter. Add the cubed cold butter and mix it in with your hands, squishing it through your fingers to incorporate it fully. Don't worry about any lumps that you may have at this point. Add the wet ingredients. Spoon in the beaten egg yolks, the yogurt and the cream. Using a spoon, combine it all together well to make a chunky dough. Roll the dough. Sprinkle some flour onto a working surface, place the dough onto it and then sprinkle the dough with some flour. With your rolling pin, start to roll the dough backwards and forwards into a 1.5cm/0.5" thick rough circle. Using the small cutter, cut the dough into 4cm/2" rings and place on a baking tray lined with baking paper. You can also scoop spoonfuls of the dough and drop them on the cookie sheet. Shape as round as possible. Continue to roll, cut and transfer to the baking tray, until all the dough is used, making sure that there is enough room for expansion between each scone. You may find you have to cook the scones in batches. Bake. Place the scones into the preheated oven and bake for roughly 12 minutes. Remove from the oven after this time. The time it takes to cook may vary depending on the oven. Serve. Eat them hot or cold with some butter if you wish, or with a dollop of fresh cream and enjoy with your afternoon tea! Finished.
